turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I saved you.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Ha!  What a load of crap.  Look at yourself, Caesar.  You're a thug. |You launder money for the mob.  You rent women like you rented this apartment.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Saved me?  You don't even know me. You used me, Caesar, just like I used you.  All part of the business.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You betrayed me!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You murdered Gino!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I had to.  You made me.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Bullshit, you killed him.  Not me. You did it because you couldn't stand the thought of Johnnie fucking you.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You're blowing your only chance. Act like I'm Gino.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Holy shit, I don't believe it!  We've been going crazy over here, Gino!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Good boy.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: We were in a car accident --

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: They were in a car accident.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: But everybody is all right.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: They're all fine.  Just bruises and shit.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Now you listen to me, asshole, I know your gun is behind the bar ...

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: We make a deal or I come out and hand this phone to Mickey.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I'm listening.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I want what's mine, half the money. We get rid of Mickey, no one else dies.  No one.  Say yes, I understand.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Yes, I understand.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Tell them I'm at St. Mary's off the Kennedy, in the waiting room, but stay on the phone until I come out.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Sure, Gino, sure.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Now that's teamwork.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I should have let him kill you.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You know he would have done you, too.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I knew I couldn't trust you.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, don't.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What are you going to do, V?  Shoot me?  Kill me in cold blood?  I don't think so.  I'll tell you why.  If you had it in you to pull that trigger, you would have done it a long time ago.  If I was you, I would have killed me the minute I brought the money home.  But you didn't and I know why, because you don't want to kill me.  Do you, V?  Do you? No, I know you don't.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar, you don't know shit.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: How's it going tonight, fellas?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Pretty good, sir.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Fuck, this happened before.  It's this shitty ear.  Born with it.  The batteries wore out in my aid.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: It's all right, sir.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Not on duty, sorry.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Oh, right.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I'm going to make myself a drink, if that's okay?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Go right ahead, sir.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Try to keep the extra batteries for your aid around.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You planned this whole thing, didn't you?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where's the fucking money?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: You're helping Rajeev?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No.  Rajeev's in India.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: How many'd you do?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Five.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Good.  I hate to worry.  I got ulcers.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I should be going.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: What?  How about a drink?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: My brushes, I have to clean my brushes.  Thanks, though.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Another time.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Now, where the fuck is my money?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Lick me.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Either pull the trigger or get that thing out of my face.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I'm going to ask you where the money is.  Every time you don't give me an answer, I'm going to cut off one finger.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: When I reach ten, then I'll start with you.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You can't kill me yet.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I could be lying.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Now why don't you go watch some TV or something?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Are you okay, Violet?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Mickey, why is Johnnie here?  You know how I feel about that fucking psycho.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Caesar, didn't I tell you to get something?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Sure, Mickey.  Sure.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Hey, Mickey.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Mick, I know it's late, but there is a problem.  They haven't shown up yet.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: What?  They ain't there?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No.  I don't know where they are.  I even called over at Johnnie's, but no answer.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Okay.  Let me call around.  I'll see what I can do.  Don't go anywhere, okay?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Okay, sure, Mick.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Caesar, you still got the money?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Yeah, Mick.  I've got the money. I'm staring right at it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Good.  Sit tight.  I'll call you.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: No, Cease.  There was no answer.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I thought I heard someone knocking.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I was buzzing, I was knocking, but I guess you couldn't hear me on account of being in the shower.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Yeah, it was Violet's idea.  I was so wound up about Gino, she was trying to help me relax.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: That Violet is one nice lady.  Wish someone would help me relax.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Shit, Mick, come on in, let me get you a drink.  Sit down, Lou.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: We was worried about you, Cease.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Me?  Why?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: We went over to Johnnie's place just to check it out and it was busted up, Bad.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: I started thinking maybe it's about the money so I call you, but all I get is the busy signal.  I figure the phone is off the hook, that's why I come rushing over here.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Oh Christ, the phone ...  That was a fucking stupid thing to do, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hey, if Violet was helping me relax, I'd probably do the same thing.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Cease, can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Why'd you move all the furniture around?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Actually, yeah, she was nervous about Gino coming, wanted everything to look right.  You know women, Mick.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Sure, Cease.  They make us do stupid things, don't they.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Is that the money?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Yeah, that's it.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Hey, Caesar, where's the key?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: The key, yeah, the key's in my pants in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Fuck it, I don't need the key.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: It's Gino!  It's Gino!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Where in the hell is he?

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Un-fucking-believable.  I called those highway patrol dumb fucks.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Ssh!  I can't hear Gino!

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: You got the key?

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Oh yeah.  Violet!

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: Call me as soon as you get him.

turns.speaker: MICKEY
turns.text: Leave your phone on the hook.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: This is the police, ma'am.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: We had a report of gunfire, so if you could --

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Gunfire?  Is this a joke?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: No joke, ma'am.  Please open the door.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: How do I know you are cops?

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: Ma'am, you have to open the door.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: See?  We're for real.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm sorry, it's just you hear stories.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: You did the right thing.

turns.speaker: COP #1
turns.text: This is a beautiful place.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: ...  thank you.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Hi.  My name is Violet.  We sort of met in the elevator --

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Yeah, sure.  I'm Corky.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I heard you working in here and I just wondered if you'd like a cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Rajeev, the man who usually works on the building.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Oh, he went home to India, but as far as I know he'll be back.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: So this is temporary for you?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Pretty much.  One day at a time.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I guessed you were straight black.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Good guess.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Mmmm ...  thanks, I needed this.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: My pleasure ...  but to be honest, I did have a slightly ulterior motive here.  I was wondering if I could ask a small favor?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: A favor?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yeah, see, I'm kind of a night person, so I was wondering if it wasn't a terrible inconvenience if you could wait a bit before using power tools.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry --

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: No, it isn't your fault.  The walls here are just so thin.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Are they really?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yes, it really causes problems. Sometimes it's like you're in the same room.  But if it's too much trouble, I understand ...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No, no trouble.  There's other work to do.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You're doing everything yourself?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: That is so amazing.  I'm in awe of people who can fix things.  My dad was like that.  We never had anything new.  Whenever something broke he would open it up, tinker with it and it would work.  His hands were magic.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Truck.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Truck.  Of course.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: '63 Chevy.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I knew it.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: So, how do you know the owner, Mr. Bianchinni?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I don't, really.  I was referred to him.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh, really.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Do you know him?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: No, but Caesar does.  He likes him. Says he's a good Italian.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Caesar is your husband?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh no, no.  I'm not the marrying kind.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I should be going.  You can drop the cup off anytime.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: My pleasure.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh no.  Shit.  I didn't know he would call you.  God, you must think |I'm a total nuisance.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Not exactly.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm sorry, I usually would call Rajeev, but I didn't know what to do so I called Mr. Bianchinni.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: He said you lost something.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yeah, come on in.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm sorry, look, forget it.  I shouldn't have called...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I told Bianchinni I would take a look.  Is it that sink?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Do you have a pot or a bucket?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Thank you so much.  You have to let me pay you something --

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No.  Mr. Bianchinni asked me to do it.  I did it.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Okay, one drink.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: A beer?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: A beer.  Of course.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You seem uncomfortable.  Do I make you nervous, Corky?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Curious, maybe.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Curious?  That's funny, I'm feeling a bit curious myself right now.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Are you surprised that I know what it is?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I have a tattoo, would you like to see it?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Isn't it obvious?  I'm trying to seduce you.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Because I want to.  I've wanted to since I first saw you in the elevator.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You dropped that earring down the drain on purpose, didn't you?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: If I say yes, will you take your hand away?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: ...  yes.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I had to see you.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Look, I don't think this is a good idea.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I wanted to apologize.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Don't apologize, please.  I can't stand women who apologize for wanting sex.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: ...  I needed that.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Caesar's Mafia, isn't he?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You have to ask?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Funny, nobody calls it that anymore. Caesar calls it "The |Business."

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: How did you meet him?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: They took over a club I was working at.  Caesar started managing it.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: He's a launderer?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Basically.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: How long have you been with him?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Almost five years.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Five years is a long time.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: The redistribution of wealth.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Isn't that what you wanted to know? What I did time for?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: The redistribution of wealth?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: That's what I tell someone when I'm trying to get them in my bed.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm already in your bed.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: My cellmate would say she did her time for getting caught.  She was always more honest than me.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You didn't have to tell me if you didn't want to.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I guess I wanted to.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm glad you did.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yes there is.  I felt it this morning when I brought you the coffee.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Shit, here we go.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You didn't want to see me, did you?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: If there is one thing I can't stand about sleeping with women, it's all the fucking mind reading.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What are you afraid of?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I'm not afraid of anything.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I don't understand - ?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I know!  You can't understand, because we're different, Violet.  We're different.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: We're not that different, Corky.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: How can you sit in that bed and say that?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Because it's the truth.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Let me guess.  This is where you tell me that what matters is on the inside.  That inside you, there is a little dyke just like me?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Oh no, she's nothing like you.  She's a lot smarter than you.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Is that what her daddy tells her?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I know what I am.  I don't need to have it tattooed on my shoulder.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What are you saying?  That you don't have sex with men?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: For Christ's sake, Violet!  I heard you!  Thin walls, remember?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What you heard wasn't sex.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What the fuck was it?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: All my life, everyone has been telling me that when I have sex, I'm not really having sex.  Not real sex. But they're wrong.  I know what is and isn't sex and what you heard was definitely not sex.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What was it then?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Work.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: We make our own choices and we pay our own prices.  I think we're more alike than you want to admit.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What about that guy this morning?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You mean Shelly?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Don't tell me, you're a workaholic.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: No.  Shelly knows what I am.  He saw me in a bar with another woman.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I suppose he just wants to watch.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Fuck it!  I think you better leave.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I think so, too.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Shelly was skimming from the business. He came to see me yesterday because he was afraid Caesar figured it out. He wanted to run but he wanted me to come with him.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Even though he knew about you?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: He was in love with you, right?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: That's what he told himself.  But it wasn't even about me, it was about Caesar.  He wanted what Caesar had. That's how they are.  I understand them.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: For Shelly, taking the money was a way to take from Caesar.  He could have run at any time, but he didn't because he didn't want out.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Sounds like he wanted to get caught.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Maybe he did.  He would brag to me all the time.  He was never afraid of Caesar because he didn't know him.  Not like I do.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar lives for these moments.  He tells me it's just the business, but I know it's more than that.  He likes it.  The violence.  I'll catch him in the bathroom mirror touching his scars.  He says they remind him who he his.  They're all like that. Except maybe Mickey.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Mickey?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: He's the part of the business that the rest of them pretend to be. |But Mickey doesn't like it like they do.  I suppose that's why he's good at it.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I want out.  I want a new life.  I see what I've been waiting for, but I need you, Corky.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You made a choice once.  Do you think you would make that same choice again?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What choice?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: If those quarters fell to the floor, would you still reach up to that cash register?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar is going to get the money and bring --

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: How much money?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Shelly said it was over two million dollars.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Caesar will bring it to the apartment to count and go through |Shelly's books to figure out how he did it.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute.  Do you have any idea what you are saying? You are asking me to help you fuck the mob.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: These people are serious, Violet. If you want to know how serious, ask Shelly.  They're worse than any cop because they have lots of money and no rules.  You fuck them, you've got to do it right.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: That's why I need your help.  You said you were good.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I am, but ...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: All right, let's say for the moment that I believe everything you are saying.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You think I'm lying?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I didn't say that, but since you did, let's say that you are.  It would have been easy to set Shelly up.  You could have got him killed knowing that Caesar would bring the money to the apartment.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: All you would need to keep yourself clean would be someone unconnected, someone like me.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Is that what you think?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I'm just making a point.  You have no idea what you're asking.  How much trust two people need to do something like this.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: The difference is, I can have sex with someone I just met, someone I hardly know, but to steal I need to know someone like I know myself.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Do you think you know me like that?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: I think ...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You said he washed the money?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Then what?  Exactly.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: He hung it up.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: To let it dry.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: And where is it now?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: In his office.  I saw it this morning.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: It's in a case, on his desk.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Does the case lock?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: All right, now, tell me about Johnnie.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Johnnie?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: It sounded like he and Caesar don't like each other.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Like each other?  They hate each other.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: It started way before I was around. I think basically it's because he thinks Johnnie is a complete idiot. But Johnnie runs Chicago because Gino is his father.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Who is Gino?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Gino Marzzone.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Marzzone?  As in Angelo Marzzone, head of the Marzzone family?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: That's his brother.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: ...  shit.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Gino Marzzone is coming tonight to pick up the money?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: And Johnnie is his son, that's Johnnie Marzzone?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Sweet Jesus.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Gino Marzzone is coming to your apartment.  It's a big deal, isn't it?  That means Caesar will be ready. He doesn't want to look like an idiot. Gino has been there before?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Yeah, twice.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Not much, really.  Caesar was nervous, kept cleaning the apartment.  |The first time, he picked out the dress he wanted me to wear.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Does Johnnie hit on you?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Johnnie hits on anything in high heels.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Has Caesar ever seen him?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: He does it right in front of him.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: It's getting better and better. Keep going.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Gino doesn't know English, or at least he pretends he doesn't, so he doesn't talk much.  He gets right to the point.  Both times they talked for about five minutes, had one drink and then they left.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What did Gino drink?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Scotch, Glenlivet.  I remember that Caesar made a huge deal about it.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: What time did you say they would be there?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: The plane is in at seven, so I'd say about eight.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Any bodyguards?

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Gino travels with a big man named Roy.  Caesar calls him the driver.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: We want him to come down, to relax, feel in control again.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Poor boy, has to work so hard.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Where will you be?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Waiting in the apartment next door.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: And as you do, the bottle will slip from your hands.  -- and shatter against the hardwood floor.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: An accident.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Shit!  Oh shit!

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: What if he sees you?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: He won't.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: You can't know for certain that he won't see you.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Trust me, Violet.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I'm just asking, what if?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: If he does ...

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: There is no going back.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: When I get the Scotch, how do I know you won't take off?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: The same way I'll know that you went to Scotch.  Trust.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: I still don't see how I'm going to get clean with the money in the apartment.  Everyone will think I did it.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Not Caesar.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: Because of what you are going to tell him.  You have to make it as real as you can.  The moment you open the door with the Scotch in your hand, you will be covered, and that moment is the most important moment in the plan.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: If it's real enough, he'll believe it, because deep down he'll want to.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: C!  Shit, I'm sorry!

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: He'll have to run.

turns.speaker: VIOLET
turns.text: If he runs, everyone will assume he took the money.

turns.speaker: CORKY
turns.text: You'll be clean and we'll be rich.
